greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rectangular array A read by upward antidiagonals in which the entry in row n and column k is defined by A(n,k) = S(4*A257499(n,k) - 3), n,k >= 1, where the function S is as defined in A257480.
comment: Theorem: For all indices n and k such that n + k > 2, log(A(n,k))/log(A257499(n,k)) < log_2(3).
Conjecture: Arranging the sequence in ascending order gives A189707 (positions of 0 in A189706).
formula: A(n,k) = S(4*A257499(n,k) - 3) = (3 + 3^n*(6*k - 3 + 2*(-1)^n))/6, where the function S is as defined in A257480.
For all k, A(1,k) <= A257499(1,k), and A(n,k) > A257499(n,k), for all n > 1.
results.author: _L. Edson Jeffery_, May 02 2015
